questions.question_text: A cybersecurity analyst is currently investigating a server outage. The analyst has discovered the following value was entered for the username: 0xbfff601a. Which of the following attacks may be occurring?

discussion.content: This question was in the exam :)

A - Buffer Overflow Attack - input validation attack; the input buffer that is used to hold program input is over written with data that is larger than the buffer and hold
B - Man-in-the-middle - attack is able to place himself in the middle of two other hosts that are communicating: Via session hijacking is a common method.
C - Smurf Attack - attacker sends a spoofed packet to the broadcast address for a network, which distributes the packet to all systems on that network
D - Format String attack - type of buffer overflow; for the format strings used by the printf family functions in the standard C library. 0x00000000
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8dcUkJYn-Mk
E - Denial of Service attack - attacker attempts to deny authorized users access either to specific information or to the computer system or network itself. Accomplished by crashing the system - taking it offline - or by sending so many requests that the machine is overwhelmed

questions.question_text: A cybersecurity analyst has identified a new mission-essential function that utilizes a public cloud-based system. The analyst needs to classify the information processed by the system with respect to CIA. Which of the following should provide the CIA classification for the information?

An executive tasked a security analyst to aggregate past logs, traffic, and alerts on a particular attack vector. The analyst was then tasked with analyzing the data and making predictions on future complications regarding this attack vector. Which of the following types of analysis is the security analyst MOST likely conducting?

discussion.content: What about default gateway as a port on the switch
Isn't proxy supposed to be between users and external destinations ?

comments.content: There are things called reverse-proxies which receive the request on behalf of the server.

questions.question_text:
A malicious user is reviewing the following output:
root:~#ping 192.168.1.137
64 bytes from 192.168.2.1 icmp_seq=1 ttl=63 time=1.58 ms
64 bytes from 192.168.2.1 icmp_seq=2 ttl=63 time=1.45 ms
root: ~#
Based on the above output, which of the following is the device between the malicious user and the target?

The business has been informed of a suspected breach of customer data. The internal audit team, in conjunction with the legal department, has begun working with the cybersecurity team to validate the report. To which of the following response processes should the business adhere during the investigation?

choices.C: The security analysts should interview system operators and report their findings to the internal auditors
choices.D: The security analysts should limit communication to trusted parties conducting the investigation
choices.A: The security analysts should not respond to internal audit requests during an active investigation
choices.B: The security analysts should report the suspected breach to regulators when an incident occurs
